intro: Psychotria muscicola, commonly known as the mossy Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, where it typically grows in humid, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its small, dark green leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It is often found in lowland rainforests and is adapted to thrive in nutrient-poor soils. Psychotria muscicola plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and nectar for various pollinators.
